evidence.pdf_reference: to light irradiation, the reactor was vacuum treated, and then the CO2 in reactor was produced by the reaction of NaHCO3 and concentrated H2SO4.After that, 3 mL deionized water were injected into the reactor followed by the switch on of light.At given interval time, 200 L of reacted gas were withdrawn to check products using GC-7820.The detailed process of photocatalytic reduction of CO2 is shown in figure S1. of the materials were tested by UV-2550 (Shimadzu, Japan). The photocatalytic performance of the samples was investigated by the reduction of CO2 with H2O using 300 W Xe lamp as irradiation source, carrying out in a self-designed glassware photoreactor (volume 500 mL).Desired amount (50 mg) of particles and an appropriate amount of water was added into a glass culture dish (60 mm), ultrasonically spread the sample evenly and then placed the culture dish in an oven for drying.Prior to light irradiation, the

implying that the detected CO was really photocatalytic reduced from CO2.What's interesting, under the irradiation of UV light, 5BSCN composite showed obvious CO production with the rate of ca.4.2 molgh, while under the irradiation of visible and NIR lights, only tiny CO yield was observed.At the same time, with full spectrum of Xe lamp irradiation, the CO producing rate of the sample composite reached 8.2 molgh.These interesting results could get two informations.On one hand, means that the visible and

test, which should be owing to the loss of particles during washing samples and the residue by-productions left on the surface of sample covering the active sites.In addition, small amounts of H2 production were also produced in the photocatalytic process by water splitting because of the suitable CB position of the samples.But the selectivity for CO2 reduction reached above 90 as compared to H2 evolution.
